definition: magpie bridge across the Milky Way between Altair and Vega where Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女 are allowed an annual meeting
magpie
bridge/CL:座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Only once a year, the couple could meet on the Milky Way.
sentences.chinese: 牛郎与织女一年才能在鹊桥上相会一次。

sentences.english: However, it is still a day to celebrate the annual meeting of the loving couple, the Cowherd and the Girl Weaver.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它仍是牛郎织女一年一度的鹊桥相会日。

sentences.english: The writer considers that knowledge band is a bridge to lead enterprise knowledgeable.
sentences.chinese: 认为知识银行是企业实现知识化发展的鹊桥。

sentences.english: Maybe like the magpies of Tanabata meet, I am a bridge between two cultures.
sentences.chinese: 可能就像情人节的鹊桥那样吧，我是两种文化的桥梁。

sentences.english: Many people use internet dating websites to meet new people.
sentences.chinese: 现在很多人都利用专门的鹊桥网站来认识新朋友。

definition: Cowherd and Weaving maid (characters in folk story)/separated lovers/Altair and Vega (stars)
Vega (star)/Weaving girl of folk tales
The Broken Bridge (at West Lake in Hangzhou)
Milky Way/also called 銀河|银河[Yin2 he2]
to yearn/to pine
matchmaker/go-between/same as 月下老人[yue4 xia4 lao3 ren2]
(flying) wing to wing
to meet together
Cowherd of the folk tale Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女/Altair (star)
cowherd boy/(slang) male prostitute
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
Vega, brightest star in constellation Lyra 天琴星座
a marriage predestined in a former life (idiom)
from dawn to dusk/all the time
magpie
(literary) that person (usually female)/she/one's intended
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
